intro: Esenbeckia collina subsp. conspecta, commonly known as the coastal esenbeckia, is a shrub native to coastal regions of southern South America. It is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that appear in terminal clusters. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dune environments. It has a compact growth habit and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Its botanical features make it a distinctive component of coastal flora.
